task.title: Creating a Table
task.shortdesc: This tutorial shows you how to create a Symbian SQL table.

context.p: This tutorial uses code from the Basic SQL example application.
You have a database. The database has no tables and therefore no data.
The following SQL statements are used for this example:

p.userinput: CREATE TABLE Pets( person TEXT, cat SMALLINT, dog SMALLINT, rodent SMALLINT, bird SMALLINT)

context.p: The RSqlDatabase::Exec function provides a mechanism for executing Symbian SQL statements.

step.info: The steps required to create a table are shown here:

substep.cmd: Declare a constant to hold the table handle:

stepxmp.codeblock: _LIT(KTabCreate,"CREATE TABLE Pets( person TEXT, cat SMALLINT, dog SMALLINT, rodent SMALLINT, bird SMALLINT);");

substep.stepresult: KTabCreate will be used later by the SQL EXECUTE command.

substep.info: This creates an RSqlDatabase object, which is needed to execute the SQL statement.
This will execute the SQL statement to create the table.

step.stepresult: The table now exists and you can begin adding data to it.

result.p: Your database now has at least one table. You can begin to add data to the table and you can query and edit it.
